head.title: National Briefing | Northwest: Washington: Eruptions Are Pollution Source

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | Northwest: Washington: Eruptions Are Pollution Source

abstract.p: Mount St Helens, which began series of small eruptions in October, has become Washington State's biggest polluter, each day spewing 50 to 250 tons of sulfur dioxide; experts say volcano's remote site mitigates danger to humans (S)

block.p: Mount St. Helens, which began a series of small eruptions in October, has become the state's biggest polluter. Each day the mountain is spewing 50 to 250 tons of sulfur dioxide, which causes acid rain and breathing problems. ''On a daily basis, it's bigger than any single source in the state,'' said Clint Bowman, an atmospheric physicist with the state's Department of Ecology. Experts say the volcano's remote site should mitigate effects of the gasses on humans.
